page.title: 17Pigeon Tower / The Dovecote.
page.content: The precise history of the {Pigeon {Tower}or {Dovecote}is unknown. Some think that it was orginally a lookout tower, or part of the old Abbey, whilst others think it may have been a dwelling of some sort. Undoubtedly, the building was used as a pigeon loft and includes spaces for 200 nests. Furthermore, there is clear evidence that the building once had a floor at first storey level and a fireplace; windows have been altered and some have been blocked. A drawing of the building in the early 18th century shows that it had a chimney and a roof. It is very much a building surrounded by mystery, and is now in the care of the National Trust.
